title: New​
content: </> RjacModule:New( ProfileInfo: table-- The data which will be overwritten while returning the class ) → RjacProfiletable-- Returns the RjacProfile which has been fully creating according to the provided ProfileInfo Create a new RjacProfile

title: Player​
content: </> Rjac.Player: Player  The player/owner of this profile

title: Character​
content: </> Rjac.Character: Model  The character of the player/owner of this profile

title: Configurations​
content: </> Rjac.Configurations: table The configurations for the joints, which will be rotated

title: Direction​
content: </> Rjac.Direction: Vector3  The direction of the camera according to the Character's HumanoidRootPart

title: Enabled​
content: </> Rjac.Enabled: boolean Controls if the parts will rotate per frame

title: Initiate​
content: </> Rjac:Initiate() → () Basically start the processing of the Object.

title: CharacterAdded​
content: </> Rjac:CharacterAdded() → () Rotates the body joints once, according to the camera direction.

title: UpdateCharacter​
content: </> Rjac:UpdateCharacter() → () Rotates the body joints once, according to the camera direction.

title: UpdateDirection​
content: </> Rjac:UpdateDirection( CameraCFrame: CFrame -- The camera CFrame of the player ) → () Updates the direction of where the character is supposed to look at.

title: AddBodyJoint​
content: </> Rjac:AddBodyJoint( BodyPart: string,-- The name of the part which will be affected BodyJoint: string,-- The name of the joint which will be rotated MultiplierVector: Vector3 -- The value which affects the rotations ) → () Adds a body joint which will be affected by the Object.

title: RemoveBodyJoint​
content: </> Rjac:RemoveBodyJoint( BodyPart: string,-- The name of the part which will be affected BodyJoint: string-- The name of the joint which will be rotated ) → () Removes a body joint which will be affected by the Object.

title: UpdateBodyJointOffset​
content: </> Rjac:UpdateBodyJointOffset( BodyPart: string,-- The name of the part which will be affected BodyJoint: string,-- The name of the joint which will be rotated JointOffset: CFrame -- The offset by which the joint will be rotated ) → () Updates the joint offset configuration of the given BodyJoint. Can be used when the character is being rotated but the body parts still need to face the camera direction.

title: UpdateBodyJointMultiplierVector​
content: </> Rjac:UpdateBodyJointMultiplierVector( BodyPart: string,-- The name of the part which will be affected BodyJoint: string,-- The name of the joint which will be rotated MultiplierVector: Vector3 -- The value which affects the rotations ) → () Adds a body joint which will be affected by the Object.
